intro: Heptapleurum megalanthum, commonly known as the giant heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of China, particularly in Yunnan and Sichuan provinces. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in panicles, typically blooming in the spring. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and hardy nature.
